headline.main: Reported Atrocities by Iraqi Forces Could Risk Aid Under U.S. Law
headline.print_headline: Reported Atrocities by Iraqi Forces Could Risk Aid Under U.S. Law

docs.snippet: Reported atrocities by Iraqi soldiers could risk some U.S. aid under a law forbidding assistance to those responsible for human rights abuses if they are confirmed, a key senator cautioned on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Reported atrocities by Iraqi soldiers could risk some U.S. aid under a law forbidding assistance to those responsible for human rights abuses if they are confirmed, a key senator cautioned on Wednesday.

headline.main: U.N. Peacekeepers Barred Seven Congolese Officers Over Rights Records
headline.print_headline: U.N. Peacekeepers Barred Seven Congolese Officers Over Rights Records

docs.snippet: The United Nations peacekeeping mission in the Democratic Republic of Congo barred seven Congolese army and police officers from receiving support after ruling there was a "real risk" they could commit human rights abuses, according to a U.N. repo...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations peacekeeping mission in the Democratic Republic of Congo barred seven Congolese army and police officers from receiving support after ruling there was a "real risk" they could commit human rights abuses, according to a U.N. report.

docs.snippet: You have something important to say at TED, but your outfit also sends a message....

headline.main: 'Still Alice' Writer-Director Richard Glatzer Dies at 63
headline.print_headline: 'Still Alice' Writer-Director Richard Glatzer Dies at 63

docs.snippet: Richard Glatzer, who co-wrote and directed the Alzheimer's drama "Still Alice" alongside his husband, Wash Westmoreland, while battling ALS, died Tuesday in Los Angeles. He was 63....
docs.lead_paragraph: Richard Glatzer, who co-wrote and directed the Alzheimer's drama "Still Alice" alongside his husband, Wash Westmoreland, while battling ALS, died Tuesday in Los Angeles. He was 63.

headline.main: Giffords Shooting Victim Who Held Down Attacker Dies
headline.print_headline: Giffords Shooting Victim Who Held Down Attacker Dies

docs.snippet: Bill Badger was a hero even before he helped save people's lives during the Jan. 8, 2011, shooting in a grocery store parking lot that killed six people and injured 13, including former U.S. Rep. Gabby Giffords....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bill Badger was a hero even before he helped save people's lives during the Jan. 8, 2011, shooting in a grocery store parking lot that killed six people and injured 13, including former U.S. Rep. Gabby Giffords.

headline.main: Varoufakis Says ECB Policy on Greece 'Asphyxiating'
headline.print_headline: Varoufakis Says ECB Policy on Greece 'Asphyxiating'

docs.snippet: The European Central Bank is pursuing a restrictive policy on Greece to exert pressure on Athens and its official lenders to agree on a path that will lead the country out of its crisis, Greece's finance minister said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank is pursuing a restrictive policy on Greece to exert pressure on Athens and its official lenders to agree on a path that will lead the country out of its crisis, Greece's finance minister said on Thursday.

headline.main: Bayern Hopeful Robben, Ribery Injuries Not Serious
headline.print_headline: Bayern Hopeful Robben, Ribery Injuries Not Serious

docs.snippet: Bayern Munich's Franck Ribery and Arjen Robben limped off during the 7-0 demolition of Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League last-16 second leg on Wednesday but coach Pep Guardiola said neither injury looked too serious....
docs.lead_paragraph: Bayern Munich's Franck Ribery and Arjen Robben limped off during the 7-0 demolition of Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League last-16 second leg on Wednesday but coach Pep Guardiola said neither injury looked too serious.

docs.snippet: U.S. crude stockpiles rose last week to record highs for the ninth straight week, despite oil prices that continue to fall, as the dollar strengthens. Bobbi Rebell reports....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. crude stockpiles rose last week to record highs for the ninth straight week, despite oil prices that continue to fall, as the dollar strengthens. Bobbi Rebell reports.

headline.main: Secret Service Investigating Agents' Crash Near White House
headline.print_headline: Secret Service Investigating Agents' Crash Near White House

docs.snippet: The Homeland Security Department is investigating two senior Secret Service agents accused of crashing a car into a White House security barrier, an agency spokesman said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Homeland Security Department is investigating two senior Secret Service agents accused of crashing a car into a White House security barrier, an agency spokesman said Wednesday.
